snippet: After Christine Rubino, a fifth-grade teacher in Brooklyn, posted some rather impolitic comments about her students on Facebook in 2010, the Department of Education fired her.
abstract: State appellate panel upholds lower court ruling that Christine Rubino, fifth-grade teacher in Brooklyn, should not have been fired from Public School 203 after making negative comments on her Facebook page about her students; New York City says it plans to appeal decision.
lead_paragraph: After Christine Rubino, a fifth-grade teacher in Brooklyn, posted some rather impolitic comments about her students on Facebook in 2010, the Department of Education fired her.

headline.seo: Brooklyn Teacher Who Talked Out of School Can Keep Her Job
headline.main: Teacher’s Facebook Post Didn’t Warrant Firing, a Panel Upholds
headline.print_headline: Teacher’s Facebook Post Didn’t Warrant Firing, a Panel Upholds
